references.paper_title: Do as I can, not as I say: Grounding language in robotic affordances
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the current work as it explores the grounding of language in robotic affordances, a key aspect of visuomotor policy learning.

references.paper_title: Diffusion policy: Visuomotor policy learning via action diffusion
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel diffusion-based approach for visuomotor policy learning, which serves as a strong baseline and comparison for the proposed CARP method.
This foundational paper on diffusion probabilistic models provides the theoretical underpinnings for many diffusion-based methods, including those compared against CARP.

references.paper_title: What matters in learning from offline human demonstrations for robot manipulation
references.reason: This paper is important as it provides benchmarks and datasets used for evaluating visuomotor policy learning methods, directly relevant to the experimental setup of the CARP paper.

references.paper_title: Sparse diffusion policy: A sparse, reusable, and flexible policy for robot learning
references.reason: This paper presents a state-of-the-art diffusion-based approach, directly compared to CARP, highlighting the advancements of CARP in multi-task settings and efficiency.
